measured_by: single-item parent self-report rating of the child’s capability at putting on clothes (1–5 Likert scale)
justification: "After the activity, parents completed a questionnaire… including one that assessed their belief about their child's skill. Specifically, parents were asked how capable they believed their child is at putting on clothes, with responses ranging from 1 ('not at all capable') to 5 ('extremely capable')."

measured_by: percentage of the 11 dressing subtasks that parents completed for the child
justification: "Our key dependent variable was the percentage of subtasks (out of 11) that parents completed for their child while their child was getting dressed."

measured_by: average time (seconds) children needed to complete each dressing subtask in a preliminary study
justification: "To estimate subtask difficulty, we used the average time it takes children to complete each of the 11 subtasks involved in putting on the hockey clothes… we obtained these averages using a preliminary study…"

measured_by: experimental assignment to Learning vs. Control condition that framed the task as a learning opportunity or not
justification: "To measure perceived learning rewards, we relied on parents' assignment to one of two experimental conditions. Parents were either assigned to a Learning condition… or a Control condition…"
